snippet: With a wave of highly publicized hirings in the off-season, N.H.L. teams snapped up the best of a new breed of advanced hockey statisticians who have found ways to quantify the game.
abstract: NHL teams, in wave of off-season hires, have snapped up the best of a new breed of advanced hockey statisticians who have found ways to quantify the game's complexities; hockey has long lagged behind other sports in implementing quantitative analytics, but coming season is likely to mark significant departure.

byline.contributor: Allan Kreda contributed reporting from Uniondale, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: With a wave of highly publicized hirings in the off-season, N.H.L. teams snapped up the best of a new breed of advanced hockey statisticians who have found ways to quantify the game.

headline.main: Far From Days of Original Six, N.H.L. Adopts Complex Numbers
headline.print_headline: Far From Days of Original Six, N.H.L. Adopts Complex Numbers
